Watched it yesterday, that's some serious glow-in-the-dark shit. Been thinking about uploading the video and file on ZN somewhere  in case they're taken down.

>>8d01f816-4bec-43b4-b857-1cfe1d422e58
Advertising on ZN is not a problem, there would be no way to keep track of views, but like what voat used to do it could be fixed price/month spots on the site. Links to clearnet sites could use an identifier so the owner of the site gets a % of purchases from their traffic.
Convincing advertisers that's it's worth a shot is going to be the hard part here.

depends what for
general browsing: linux + non-pozzed browser (no google chrome shit) + some extension like privacybadger, umatrix or noscript (going from weak to strong)

when to use VPN?
you want to hide your activity from your ISP or the sites you visit

when to use Tor?
you want to hide your activity from ISP, sites and the government

can you use both?
sure, but don't be a stupid and connect to your VPN through Tor, that would be like eating your food with your ass and shitting from your mouth

is it enough?
no.

>>59875618-9ffb-4742-98d7-73f7f3afd115

that said only allowing zeroid is a poor choice

>>913ea054-a957-4770-9bb9-05911c54f94a
> ZeroNet over Tor is shit
for glowniggers like yourself can't figure out who's posting

>>3814b682-d3f7-4a9e-aa40-155c9388609e
that post from 2010 make three points
> popular Bittorrent clients just ignore their socks proxy setting
ZeroNet is not a bittorrent client, and the code has been written to integrate Tor, so this is not a problem
> Bittorrent applications pick a random port to listen on, and it tells that random port to the tracker as well as to each peer
would have to look at the code to know how ZeroNet handles this, but I believe it uses a different port for each peer
> Tor puts multiple application streams over each circuit
ZeroNet uses Tor control to put each site on a different address

that post is specifically about Bittorrent application in 2010, it does not apply to ZeroNet and it doesn't even apply to all torrenting software today

> inb4 steal bandwidth from people who need it
using ZN isn't like torrenting movies, series and games, it's mostly small files getting synchronized and a lot of people here actually need to hide their traffic from the states they're in or their opinions would land them in jail

The reason to use Tor browser is some zite making clearnet connections through javascript or loading content from absolute urls that collect ips. Only downside with ZeroNet is javascript dependency, and there's no way around it.

>>12ae28d7-952f-4325-8270-f40391bc2e6f
Same story everywhere. Haven't come across a single instance of CP on ZN. Sure there's a couple of dead CP boards, but if you don't go there you don't download them.
I'm willing to bet there will be CP attacks if this thing takes off though. That's nothing a blocklist can't take care of luckily.
People also continued dying of other causes in the meantime, so it's hard to really pinpoint the number of deaths. But the official numbers sure smell like bullshit.
